activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle L. Sheltrown

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on November 30, 2022 at 08:45 am.

02:06 PM Defendant Michelle L. Sheltrown in court by phone means and with attorney Kevin M Smith and attorney Anna Hartz.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.

Activity:  Waiver of preliminary hearing  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

01:25 PM Defendant Michelle L. Sheltrown in court by phone with intern Olivia Long by video supervised by attorney Kevin M Smith by video.  Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint copy to attorney.  Reading waived.    Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.   Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on June 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
No contact with Rock County Woodmans

Activity: return on warrant initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:48 AM Defendant Michelle L. Sheltrown in court appearing by audio.  Noah M Tylenda appeared by video  for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant recalled.   Complaint filed, copy to defendant, address verified, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.   Signature bond set of $1,000.00   with conditions, No contact with Rock County Woodmans. Must sign bond Wednesday, May 25, 2022. Matter continued to allow defendant time to obtain an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on May 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

01:35 PM Defendant Michelle L. Sheltrown not in court.  Emmeline Lee and Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Bench warrant ordered on defendants nonappearance. Cash bond of $100 set. Reviewable by Court Commissioner.
Initial appearance on May 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
